position: Cyber Data Science Intern - Summer 2021 - San Mateo HQ, California
description:
At Guidewire, we offer a combination of good working conditions, an excellent market opportunity, a rational and meritocratic company culture, quality software products, and a long history of careful hiring have allowed us to create an enviable work environment.
Our Cyence Risk Analytics team helps insurers and other financial institutions to model new and evolving risks such as cyber. By combining internet-scale data listening, adaptive machine learning, and insurance risk modeling, Cyence insights help P&C customers face new risks, take advantage of new opportunities and develop new products.

What will I be doing?
Guidewire is offering a 3-month internship in the Cyence Risk Analytics team. The internship is designed to give an opportunity to work in a real-world business environment, and to take responsibility for a specific data project that has the potential to provide real value to our customers.
You will be exploring ways to enhance our data science and modelling processes. You will explore novel techniques and the creation of models that help with our classification and computational problems.
You will be mentored by experienced data scientists and modelers and exposed to advanced ML techniques and approaches. You will have the opportunity to learn more about the exciting world of Cybersecurity and Cyber Risk quantification. You will be writing Python code, wrangling data from a range of sources and building models.

Intern Requirements

    • Penultimate year or recent graduate of bachelors or master studies in a Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field.
    • Demonstrable knowledge in Python coding, in particular data manipulation
    • Knowledge and understanding in Statistics
    • Demonstrable knowledge in Machine Learning techniques.
    • Ability to work independently on a project and as part of a team.

Other things we like to cultivate

    • Curiosity based on genuine love of technology and analytics
    • Accountability based on an earnest desire to do what is expected without prompting
    • Kindness and respect for your fellow teammates
About Guidewire
Guidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.

Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. More than 400 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.

As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 1000+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our Marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.

Guidewire Software, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to an inclusive workplace, and believe that a diversity of perspectives, abilities, and cultures is a key to our success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. All offers are contingent upon passing a criminal history and other background checks where it's applicable to the position.

Disability Accommodations and Guidewire’s Appeals Process. Guidewire provides accommodations to the hiring process to create a fair opportunity for candidates with disabilities to contend for open positions. Accommodation requests should be directed to (650) 356-4940 or Accommodations@guidewire.com. If things do not go as hoped, we invite you to use our appeals process. Guidewire promises to independently review any denied accommodation and any decision not to offer you the position. The appeals process is the same in either case. Within five business days of receiving a notice of denial of an accommodation, or receiving a notice of your non-selection for a vacancy, call (650) 356-4940 or e-mail Accommodations@guidewire.com to make an appeal. Guidewire will assign a new decision-maker to review the request and/or hiring decision, who will then notify you in writing of a decision within 10 business days.

Overview:
LMI is a consultancy dedicated to powering a future-ready, high-performing government, drawing from expertise in digital and analytic solutions, logistics, and management advisory services. We deliver integrated capabilities that incorporate emerging technologies and are tailored to customers’ unique mission needs, backed by objective research and data analysis. Founded in 1961 to help the Department of Defense resolve complex logistics management challenges, LMI continues to enable growth and transformation, enhance operational readiness and resiliency, and ensure mission success for federal civilian and defense agencies.

The AI Engineer Intern will work with Forge, LMI’s internal technology accelerator and innovation hub, to develop technology solutions for LMI and its federal government clients. This position will apply machine learning and data science approaches to initiate, develop, and deliver AI within web-based applications. The AI Engineer Intern will work within a team of data scientists, computer scientists, application developers, product managers, and designers to integrate AI/ML into applications to automate and improve business processes, data quality, and user experience. The ideal candidate will have a passion for solving challenging problems by applying a diverse set of technical capabilities to program, develop models, and deploy services consumed by user applications.
Responsibilities:
  • Identify opportunities where AI/ML or modeling and simulation can generate business insights or improve business processes
  • Develop and implement digital and analytic approaches
  • Work with product designers, application developers, infrastructure engineers, and other data scientists to integrate predictive and prescriptive models with web-based applications
  • Research algorithms in machine learning to identify viable approaches to meet business requirements
  • Apply machine learning methods, such as natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, regression, clustering, classification, and deep learning
  • Design solution prototypes that connect to data sources and deploy through services, such as service functions in web applications or application programming interfaces (APIs)
  • Become familiar with DevSecOps principles to continuously deliver high-quality software
  • Work with Docker to develop and deploy containerized versions of models
  • Participate in design and code reviews, and collaborate with a strong, passionate engineering team
  • Provide input to UX/UI designers and front-end application developers on how to effectively deliver model outcomes to users
  • Interface with customer stakeholders to provide technical explanations and support
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics, computer science, or related technical discipline
  • Currently enrolled in a graduate program
  • Pursuing a post-graduate degree in engineering, mathematics, computer science, modeling and simulation, operations research, or related technical discipline
  • Must be able to work for a minimum of 10 weeks beginning in May or June of 2021
  • Comfortable working with agile teams, developing prototypes and functionality in short development sprints
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with a project team in an agile research and development environment
  • Comfortable using Atlassian products, including JIRA, Bamboo, Confluence, FishEye, Crucible, and Bitbucket
  • Ability to think critically to propose tractable solutions to complex problems
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts to both technical and business-focused audiences
  • Familiarity or desire to excel with modern programming languages appropriate for machine learning prototyping; Python is preferred, but experience with other languages such as Java, C++, C#, JavaScript and R demonstrate the necessary ability
  • Familiarity with the underlying mathematics of machine learning
  • Knowledge of data structures and data management principles, methods, and tools
  • Desire to explore machine learning frameworks and libraries, such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and Spark ML
  • Ability to work with integrated development environments, such as Jupyter, JupyterLab, JetBrains IntelliJ IDEA, JetBrains PyCharm, JetBrains CLion, and Visual Studio Code
  • Ability to collaborate with a team that develops applications using web development frameworks, such as Angular (1.x/2+), React, and Ember, and server frameworks, such as Node.js and Express.js
  • Ability to consume or interface with cloud computing and storage services, including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud
  • Familiarity or desire to become familiar with containerization technologies, such as Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS), and Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS)

position: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern - UI Engineer
description:
Requisition ID:282206
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern
Career Level: NA


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

Welcome to the Human Revolution! Intern at a company that can accelerate your development, and potentially bootstrap your future career!

For every company, people are their most important asset. SAP SuccessFactors is the platform that empowers employees to perform at their best, and for businesses to streamline the way they handle HR. We’re a multi-tenant, SaaS-offerings company, automating HR-centric processes—encompassing the entire lifecycle of employee and business partner engagement. We have: 7000+ customers, 100+ million users, and peak daily transaction rates of 1 BILLION+ per day.

We are looking for talented interns who share in our vision to deliver continuous innovation in the cloud that makes our customers successful. Join our high-energy, high-output, creative colleagues who inspire and challenge each other towards excellence.


We have:

  • Best in the cloud-space HCM application, suited for Web and mobile devices.
  • Frameworks and a platform built with cutting edge technologies, which can be customized to customers’ extreme needs.
  • Flat hierarchy, Agile SCRUM environment with development responsibilities that span across all layers of the application.
  • Opportunities to explore different solutions, show the hacker side of you, and be part of a social cause.
  • A team of experts to work with.

What you’ll do:

Position title: SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – UI Engineer

Location: San Ramon, California (Work From Home)

Expected start date to end date: June 7th, 2021 – August 13th, 2021


In this role, you’ll:


  • Re-implement one or more UIs for existing administration tools, to make them richer and more intuitive, using advanced JavaScript, HTML, and CSS in the implementation.
  • Create JavaScript unit and integration tests that can run in an automated fashion, as a part of an overall test-driven development approach.
  • Opprtunity to use React to develope enterpriese web application.
  • Opportunity to touch all non-functional requirement which Enterprise software like Web Performance, Security, Accessibitility, I18n, etc.
  • Opportunity to collaborate with different stakeholders like PM, UX, Backend Engineer, Operation team.

Who you are:

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


  • Candidates to be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or master’s degree program that is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent experience).
  • Strong programming skills in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Experience using Web-based UI frameworks, such as jQuery, Angular, React, Vue, and OpenUI5.
  • Passionate about developing rich and intuitive UIs, and re-usable UI components.
  • Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
  • Preferred experience: written code using an object-oriented language such as Java, C++, or Objective-C / Swift; and used the command-line in Unix-based environments such as Linux and MacOS.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Subsidiary: Colas Inc.


Colas Inc. is a highway construction and maintenance company headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey with 7 subsidiary companies operating in more than 25 states including Alaska, California, Wyoming, Missouri, Georgia, North and South Carolina, Virginia, Pennsylvania, New York, Ohio. Colas Inc. is part of Colas SA, www.colas.com the world leader in road construction and maintenance.

Mission

As a Colas ISS Intern, you will be part of a team of diversely skilled individuals who pride themselves in their breadth of knowledge, skills and positive attitudes. On the project team you will have the opportunity to work within a variety of disciplines (Developers, Business Analysts, Support Analysts and Project Managers) all who support our subsidiaries across North America.

Main Responsibilities

  • Independently work on special projects as assigned by functional leader.
  • Assist in implementing functional strategies and contribute to the team's success in reaching goals and objectives.
  • Support the departmental deliverables and be proactive in planning and supporting tasks.
  • intern will use the following technologies:VB.NET, ASP, data analytics project utilizing PowerBI, Azure

Qualifications

  • Pursuing Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
  • Sophomore or Junior sanding
  • Experience in one or more of the following: VB.NET, SQL, HTML5, MVC, Java, Data Analytics, Assure, Power BI
  • Good technical skills
  • Strong Analytical, Communication, Collaboration, Problem Solving and Thinking Skills
  • Experience with high-level object-oriented programming


Colas Inc.and its subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer. For details on the specifics of this commitment, please click here EEO document. If you need accomodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Colas Inc. 973-290-9082 or send an email to ColasRecruiter@colasinc.com.

Overview:

This internship is remote based and applicants can be based within Eastern time zone.


Precisely is a global leader in data integrity, providing accuracy and consistency in data for 12,000 customers in more than 100 countries, including 90 percent of the Fortune 100. Precisely’s data integration, data quality, location intelligence, and data enrichment products power better business decisions to create better outcomes. We are looking for talented individuals with the experience and motivation to join our innovative team.


Data Operations is responsible for the continuous improvement of Precisely’s data in Salesforce, NetSuite, and other enterprise systems. The Data Operations Intern will analyze new and existing data sources, both human and machine generated, to develop data pipelines to increase the quality, fidelity, and precision of our data.


The Opportunity Includes:
  • A dynamic 10-week paid internship program
  • Apply college learning and implement innovative solutions to real-world challenges
  • Interaction, networking and exposure to various levels of leadership and management
  • Amazing mentorship opportunities
  • Top summer interns may be eligible to receive full time offers to join the team following the successful completion of their degree
Applicants must meet the following requirements:
  • Ability to work 30 hours per week for 10 weeks
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States without the requirement for future sponsorship
  • Ability to work remotely which will require a working, reliable internet connection and a quiet and dedicated work space
Responsibilities:
  • Analyze source and target systems data using tools such as SQL, Microsoft Excel, Trillium DQ, Tableau, and Python
  • Improve the quality of master data to reflect customer and product strategy and segmentation and to enable better insights to be generated from the data
  • Build process automation using tools such as Silectis Magpie, Workato, Microsoft Power Automate, and SSIS
  • Improve documentation for the Data Dictionary, Data Mapping Documentation, and Business Glossary using tools such as Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Sharepoint
Qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled in accredited college/university Bacheler’s degree program in Junior year in Computer Science or related major
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite
  • Strong analytic skills including Excel Pivot Tables, Excel Power Pivot, Excel Get & Transform (Wrangle), Tableau, and scripting languages
  • Facility with ANSI SQL language
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Familiarity with Process Automation software such as Workato, Microsoft Power Automate, SSIS
  • Experience using DQ tools such as Trillium DQ
  • Experience with Content Management Software (CMS) and SharePoint automation

Join our team! As a global leader in providing title insurance, settlement services and risk solutions for real estate transactions, First American (NYSE: FAF) is an ideal place to build your career. We have been entrusted with helping our customers achieve and protect their dream of homeownership since 1889. We believe that our people are the key to the company’s continued success, and we invest in diverse talents and backgrounds and empower our teams to achieve more than they could anywhere else. First American has created an award-winning culture and has been named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the fifth consecutive year and to more than 50 regional Best Places to Work lists. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com

Job Summary

We are looking for a Network Engineer (intern) who will assist with maintaining and administering our company's computer networks. Your primary duties will include maintenance of computer networks, hardware, software, and other related systems, performing disaster recovery operations, protecting data, software, and hardware from attacks, and replacing faulty network hardware components when necessary. You will also be working closely with the users of our network to identify potential issues and fix existing problems.

Job Summary

First American’s Internship Program is a full-time, remote, paid internship that starts on June 14, 2021 and ends August 13, 2021. The Intern will work in a program designed to help college students gain experience and develop the technical, professional and interpersonal skills that will be invaluable throughout their career. As a First American Intern you will gain exposure to working in a corporate environment within the Financial/Title Industry—balanced with intern-specific activities, executive level presentations and networking opportunities—while under the close supervision and guidance of a manager and/or mentor. For this intern role, undergraduate students are assigned significant work assignments to support a specific business function within IT.

Job Qualifications:

We are seeking College/University students enrolled in Bachelor’s degree programs with 0-2 years' of work experience. Preferred Field of Study in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or Information Systems. Network experience is a plus.

Responsibilities

  • Help with day-to-day activities of the Network Engineering Team
  • Work with senior network engineers on troubleshooting and building proof-of-concept labs
  • Verify and validate configurations
  • Review logs of devices and do basic maintenance
  • Assist with various networking tasks, documentation, and testing

Network engineers are responsible for building and maintaining the day-to-day operation of computer networks that companies and organizations rely on. These networks typically include an intranet, extranet, local area network (LAN), and wide area network (WAN).

To qualify, candidates will possess the following:

  • Current undergraduate student majoring in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
  • Basic network knowledge
  • Proficiency with various operating systems
  • Understanding of basic networking open source tools iPerf, ICMP, etc…
  • Willingness to be a team player and work outside of standard hours

First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.

position: Intern, Digital Quality and Data Integrity
description:
Intern, Digital Quality and Data Integrity (DQDI), QA

Agios (agios.com) is a biopharmaceutical company committed to applying our scientific leadership in cellular metabolism to transform the lives of patients with cancer and rare genetic diseases. We are growing rapidly with an active research and discovery pipeline across both therapeutic areas. Agios has two approved oncology precision medicines and multiple first-in-class investigational therapies in clinical and/or preclinical development.

Agios Pharmaceuticals is searching for a dynamic DQDI Intern to join our growing QA team. The DQDI, QA Intern will confidently manage and maintain an inspection ready GxP Computerized System Validation archive; ensuring all GxP Computerized System Validations (CSV) and supporting Standard Operating Procedures at Agios are collected and archived in a manner the maintains its data integrity throughout the systems’ life cycles. The intern will maintain the inventory of all CSV documentation, follow the ‘True Copy’ verification process moving documentation from paper to digital Veeva platform, create appropriate metadata and ensure complete collection of all records for inspection readiness.

The intern will be expected to partner with Agios Business owners, IT and QA to perform this role.

Responsibilities (including, but are not limited to)

  • High attention to detail, excellent technical writing experience.
  • Creates, maintains, reviews and revises procedures that ensure GxP computer systems are maintained in a validated state and in a continual state of inspection readiness with regards to cGxP.
  • Collects and tracks validation deliverables and packages for GxP computer systems to ensure accessiblity throughout document life-cycle.
  • Maintains archive for compliance with company policies, procedures and government guidelines, directives and regulations.
  • Provides training on document management related topics.
  • Supports regulatory and internal audit inspections.
  • Creates and reviews routine metrics and facilitates development of appropriate action plans as well as communication with key stakeholders.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Skills and Qualifications

  • Knowledge of technical writing principles and quality systems.
  • Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, Power Point and other applications.
  • Knowledge of Veeva products desired.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate and work independently with scientific/technical personnel.

Requirements

  • Current undergraduate student majoring in IT, computer science, engineering, library science or related field
  • 2+ years of MS Visio and PowerPoint
  • 3+ years of MS Word and Excel
  • Experience in the pharmaceutical industry
  • Knowledge of Good Documentation Best Practices

Competencies

  • Analytical thought leader with strong ability to analyze systems, data, and reports to identify creative solutions
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Skilled presenter with ability to command the attention of an audience at all levels throughout an organization
  • Collaborative yet decisive leader with track record for creating agile solutions

The Getinge Internship / Co-op Program is a paid, competitive, full-time program that gives college students interested in the Medical Technology industry the opportunity to work in a challenging and dynamic culture. Working closely with Mentors, Coops and Interns have an inside look at what goes on behind the scenes at a major Medical Device company.


Students will benefit from on the job training and mentoring in their field of study/chosen department. They will participate in professional development events and workshops during their time here. Getinge’s Co-ops and Interns will have the opportunity to build professional relationships and enhance their interpersonal skills. Students should expect to contribute individually and as a team member to support a designated functional area (i.e., Operations, Research & Development, Quality, Engineering, Regulatory, and HR/Training), and work towards goals and objectives assigned by their manager/supervisor.


Position Overview: Exciting opportunity for a student to learn day-to-day activities of our research lab as well as assist the research team to develop the next generation medical devices. Students will have the opportunity to be a part of the concept development, design, prototype manufacture and test of these future products.


Job Details:


  • Assist in activities in the research lab to include test method development, documentation, test setup, test sample creation, test results documentation and test data analysis
  • Interaction with research related 3rd parties
  • Must have a willingness to work with animal tissues/animal labs
  • Willingness to work in the assembly/manufacture of prototype devices/components which may include basic /traditional assembly line

Background experience:

  • Undergraduate in Biomedical, Computer Science, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering or equivalent
  • Experience working with equipment and operation of basic machine shop tools
  • May involve travel to local third party research and test facilities.
  • Knowledge of SolidWorks CAD software.
  • Knowledge of basic statistical analysis.
  • Basic knowledge of electronic devices design/function.

Getinge is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

CME Group is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We’re small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

To learn more about what a career at CME Group can offer you, visit us at
www.wherefuturesaremade.com
.

Software Engineering Internship – Summer 2021

We are looking for motivated and talented students who want to help us solve some of the most complex challenges in financial technology. Technology teams at CME write and maintain ultra low-latency electronic trading platforms, risk management systems, and front-end trading interfaces, all of which are central to CME’s business. We are focused on designing, building and deploying customer focused solutions with passion and precision.

CME Group Technology interns will gain unparalleled experience in electronic trading and financial technology. Interns will have the opportunity to work on a variety of applications and projects that directly impact the global trading ecosystem. In the past, our interns have worked on building cloud infrastructure, researching blockchain technologies, and taking ownership of new applications that can change the trading lifecycle.

CME’s Technology Summer Internship program offers students opportunities to learn more about CME’s business, our role in the financial industry, and the types of technology that keeps our markets running. Students will develop both their technical skills and expand their network with access to industry experts, while working alongside other talented and ambitious students with a passion for FinTech.

Interns can participate in several core roles, including:

  • Application Development
  • System Design
  • Research and Proof of Concepts
  • DevOps and Cloud Migration
  • Automation

Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree
  • Studying Computer Science or a related field
  • Experience writing code in Java, Python, or C++
  • A passion for problem solving

Bonus qualifications:

  • Proficiency in Java
  • Previous technical experience
  • Experience with UNIX/Linux
  • Experience with JavaScript, SQL, or R

About CME Group:

As the world’s leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace, CME Group is where the world comes to manage risk. CME Group exchanges offer the widest range of global benchmark products across all major asset classes, including futures and options based on interest rates, equity indexes, foreign exchange, energy, agricultural products and metals. Our clients rely on our trading products to help manage their business risks. In doing so, we help maintain stability in the global economy.

Technology drives everything we do. It’s how we provide our customers with access to the world’s markets. It’s how we help keep those markets secure and always available to handle ever-increasing demand. And it’s how we build leading edge fintech solutions that help the world advance. At CME Group, you can build a career by shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success, and you own it – all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Creators, fixers, problem-solvers. Those are our people. And we’re looking for more.

BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. As an employee of the firm, you will live true to our Core Values of people first, being exceptional every day in every way, embracing change, feeling empowered through knowledge and choosing accountability. Our Core Values are the standards by which we conduct ourselves day in and day out, both internally and externally.

BDO Digital, LLC, a subsidiary of BDO USA, LLP, provides a holistic portfolio of technology, transformation services and solutions. We are an organization that values your time, talent, and contributions. Collaborate with BDO Digital’s cross-disciplinary team who work together to solve digital needs and unearth new opportunities to drive competitive advantage. Our commitment to each other is why BDO Digital is a recognized leader for our culture, employee satisfaction and career growth. We’re looking for people with the same drive; to combine teamwork with technology to produce amazing results.

The Governance, Risk & Compliance Intern (Intern) will learn about the basics of information and data risks, will be engaged to assist with client projects, and internal initiatives. The Intern will work alongside, more experienced professionals where they will conduct PCI compliance projects, national security audits, privacy assessments and information governance projects. The intern will be involved with operationalizing client processes, policies, and controls.

Qualifications

Education:
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program in Technology, Computer Science, Information Assurance, Business Management, or another related field, required
  • Enrolled in an MBA or JD program, preferred

Experience:
  • Prior internship, externship or professional experience offering experience with data management, technology, compliance, and/or business management, preferred

Software:
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, Word and PowerPoint, required
  • Adobe Acrobat, preferred
  • Microsoft SharePoint, preferred

position: Research Intern: Automated Profiling of Application Security for DevSecOps
description:
We are looking for a summer intern to investigate and develop automated methods for characterizing the security of applications that are developed using continuous development (DevSecOps)!

This task includes security profiling during code production, integration, testing, delivery, and assessment. You will learn to determine the security profile of applications by processing the language that describes tasks and functions that get implemented in the software modules. Such descriptions are typically available from project lifecycle management platforms such as Jira or Gitlab. Given the variety of methods to define application functionality, you will deal with code descriptions presented in natural language, as well as in structured and semi-structured formats. Hence, you will get an opportunity to execute tools for Natural Language Processing and static code analysis. You will build additional tools to generate security code policy description files in a standard format (e.g., JSON).

The internship will focus mostly on network communication, i.e., the policy files will contain list of servers that need to be accessed by each software module, network communication flows (i.e., network ports, addresses, protocols) established towards other resources or peer nodes, business or domain-specific process flows followed by the clients and servers, and edge cases for communications that might incur during code maintenance processes.

Furthermore, you will build a mechanism to use the policy files above as a descriptor to configure a network flow monitor installed on the same network as the profiled application. The goal of the project is to improve automating the steps required for DevSecOps by adopting a fine-grained characterization of software modules. This will increase awareness of security during code production.


The Challenge
  • Install and maintain a DevOps testbed for testing based on Jira and Gitlab, and a sample open application under development
  • Develop methods to access the APIs of Project Lifecycle Management (APM) platforms, e.g., Jira REST API
  • Use the APIs to extract code descriptions and collect them in a database, reporting versioning, bugs, fixes, snippets and analytics
  • Determine and understand methods to characterize the code and textual descriptions, using tools such as SrcML
  • Build tools to generate code behavior descriptor files using JSON
  • Create an interface to command a network monitor based on the file JSON above
  • Install a code execution and monitoring testbed, running a network monitor
The Candidate
  • A current student pursuing a MS/PhD degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering, or other related subject with a strong focus on IT-Security or Cybersecurity. Please note, you must still be enrolled as a student during the internship period to qualify for the position.
  • Experience with APIs to access web applications
  • Experience with Jira and Gitlab, or similar platforms
  • Experience with Linux and command lines
  • Experience with network monitoring tools, IPTable or network monitoring libraries
  • Software development skills (i.e. Python, Java or C/C++)
  • Prior experience with natural language processing and/or code profiling a significant plus
  • Ability to give presentations about sophisticated technical topics
  • Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/policy-guidance/deemed-exports/deemed-exports-faqs


Join Us

During this internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. An internship with Siemens Technology is a great opportunity for students to gain real world experience in a diverse work environment!

While we prefer the internship to be on site in our lab in Princeton, NJ, the uncertain future course of the pandemic makes it likely that this internship will need to happen entirely remotely. Hence, we offer this as a remote internship and thus encourage applicants from across the country.

position: Intern, Risk and Audit Security - Seattle
description:
Think you can do more with Microsoft? So do we.

Avanade is looking for passionate technologists who want to contribute to keeping our internal technology on the bleeding edge. Constant opportunities for growth and learning have helped make Avanade one of the best places to work in IT, and provide an excellent environment for interns to build skills and experience that will help launch them into exciting IT careers.

About you

The Information Security Risk and Audit team is looking for an adaptable team member to deliver high-visibility work under the service scope of our portfolio.

This role would be a great fit for someone who is looking to move into systems security auditing and risk assessment. This position will involve aiding in continuing to mature our processes, validating security compliance, researching vulnerabilities and security risk, and reviewing security risk assessments. This position may also involve assisting in other information security documentation and project efforts.

Key Responsibilities

The Risk & Audit intern will be assigned to perform tasks at the direction and under the close supervision / guidance of portfolio management. The tasks the intern will perform include, but may not be limited to the following:

Audits:
  • Support information security controls focused audits conducted by both internal and external parties.
  • Perform information security controls testing for reviews conducted by the Risk & Audit team against internal policy and regulatory requirements.
Workstation Security Exceptions:
  • Review the active workstation security exception list weekly to determine anything invalid for closure and report back efforts to portfolio management.
  • Work with submitters to address requests filled out incorrectly and identify ways to optimize the ticket template based on those we reject.
Threat Modeling:
  • Create basic process and dataflow models to support policy compliance.
  • Model infrastructure or code used for various internal and client facing projects.
  • Assist with the creation of flow models for a visual representation during audits.
Security Assessments:
  • Support the Security Assessment function through their assessment efforts including the audit of completed reviews.
  • Perform user acceptance testing for ongoing migration activities.
App Scanning:
  • Respond to ticket requests and create application teams in our application scanning system.
  • Supply post scan reports to application teams.
  • Review and maintain the application scanning service intranet site to ensure it remains current and up to date.
Other:
  • Support team with pulling data and refreshing Power BI based security risk reports.
Your skills

Years of Experience :
  • 1+ year(s) of IS industry experience preferred, including global IS organizations.
Education :
  • Attending senior year in college or university or 1 year post grad.
  • Have or currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science and Information Systems strongly desired. Courses related to risk identification and management, information systems, cybersecurity governance, risk, and compliance is desired.
Other Skills/Knowledge :
  • Working level knowledge of risk and compliance management frameworks, practices and processes and information security standards and practices, preferred.
  • Familiarity with Security auditing practices, preferred.
  • Relationship management - ability to cultivate and maintain strong networks of people who contribute to the success of the function.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to understand high level technical details and translate them into business terms.
  • Business process analysis and optimization.
Role details:
Start date : April or May 2021

Hours : 20+ hours per week / Flexibility to work around school schedule

Location : Must be able to work out of the Seattle office, once it is safe to do so

Clarity Partners is seeking emerging technology professionals who have strong technical instincts combined with the ability to think and communicate about how technology is used in the real world. This will be an onsite Summer 2021 paid undergraduate internship in downtown Chicago in one of four tracks:

Software Developer Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you learn highly marketable “full-stack” software development job skills in current software development platforms including Microsoft C#.NET, React/Redux, Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server. You will learn on-the-job as you work on projects for our exciting clients under the guidance of senior Clarity application developers. If you demonstrate progress and self-sufficiency, you will be given the opportunity to develop code independently. You will also be exposed to cloud hosting, API microservice, and DevOps concepts and will certainly see your code in production.

Qualifications for Software Developer Track

  • Completed at least 2 years of a 4-year BS degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Excellent programming skills. Experience with object oriented programming languages, preferably C#, Java, or C++
  • Knowledge of data structures and understanding of database transactions
  • Ability to translate technical specifications into working code, and solve complex problems with consideration of the end user experience
  • Familiarity with system architectural concepts
  • Written and verbal communication skills

Analytics Developer Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you learn to model, capture, transform, and visualize data using prevailing commercial and open-source platforms such as Tableau and Microsoft Power BI. You will have a real world opportunity to work on Clarity’s long term consulting engagements with our clients to leverage their numerous data sources for predictive policing and other analytical applications.

Qualifications for Analytics Developer Track

  • Completed at least 2 years of a 4-year BS degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or related field.
  • Strong Data Modeling skills
  • Understanding of comparative statistics and predictive analytical concepts
  • Hands on experience with SQL database concepts (tables, views, foreign key constraints, indexes, outer joins, etc.)
  • Some programming skills

Technical Manager / Analyst Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you learn information technology project management processes and tools. You will gather customer requirements, write functional specifications, analyze use cases, and validate requirements for real world technology projects. You will learn how technology projects work in the real world under an Agile development approach and be exposed to DevOps management and communications tools. You can also gain marketable job skills as you apply your understanding of data structures and relationships to industry leading business intelligence and reporting platforms. You will shape the outcome of actual enterprise software development work and see your results in production.

Qualifications for Technical Manager / Analyst Track

  • Completed 2 years of a BS degree in Management or related field with some technical course work
  • Understanding of project/program knowledge areas such as schedule management, scope management, communication management, quality assurance, etc
  • Strong analytical, diagramming, organizational, writing and documentation management skills
  • Some Data Modeling skills and an understanding of transaction processing concepts
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, leadership role in extracurricular activities

UX Designer Track

You will have real responsibilities and jumpstart your career as you apply your graphical and interface design skills to responsive web applications, websites, and mobile applications. You will work along side our software developers to produce design artifacts that will be merged into the developers’ code. You will have the opportunity to interact with end users and guide the application developers toward more intuitive and usable interfaces while learning the constraints of what is practical. You will learn how to design for industry leading and highly customizable content management systems such as Drupal and Wordpress.

Qualifications for UX Designer Track

  • Completed 2 years of a BS degree in Computer Graphics Technology or related field
  • Experience with relevant professional tools such as Adobe Illustrator
  • Strong instincts for usable and intuitive designs for web applications and websites
  • Candidates for this particular track will be evaluated on their portfolio of past design work. Portfolio entries need not be specific to user interfaces but should convey some degree of artistry. Having this portfolio published and accessible on the internet is highly encouraged

We are seeking a graduate intern to join our Sustainable Automation Solutions Research Group in Princeton, NJ! Our team is responsible for a variety of exciting projects in Digitalization and Sustainability with Siemens customers throughout the aerospace and automotive industries, and we need your help!

Iridium is the only truly global voice and data satellite communications network that connects people, organizations, assets, government and relief agencies with “on-the-move” availability. Together with its ecosystem of partners, Iridium delivers essential, reliable communications with an easy-to-integrate platform and service for improved efficiency. With more than 20 years of experience, Iridium delivers the next-generation of connectivity, Iridium CertusSM - the most versatile global broadband service that satisfies the critical need to send and receive communications when traveling by land, sea or air. For more information about Iridium products, services and partner solutions, visit www.iridium.com.
Position Summary, Job Requirements & Responsibilities:
The Iridium Internship Program is an opportunity for students to be a part of the Iridium teams shaping the future of satellite communications. As an Intern, you’ll begin making an impact on real projects from day one! Come prepared to grow, develop, and learn alongside the leaders of our company. The Iridium Internship program is a 12-week program that runs from May 24, 2021 to August 13, 2021. During the program, interns will have the opportunity to support an Iridium department on a project or important work assignment. Interns will also be provided an opportunity to engage with senior leadership and fellow interns via regular engagement activities. Interns will participate in an end of internship presentation, where we ask them to reflect on their summer internships and present a summary of what they have learned and accomplished.

As an Intern, Technical Writer you will assist with collecting, updating, formatting, and consolidating IT documentation of policies, procedures, tech notes, how-to documents, and existing documentation. The Intern will gain technical writing and formatting skills as well as communication skills and the team will benefit from this support through increased consistency across documentation/tasks and more streamlined processes.

Responsibilities:
  • Interview administrators and management to collect information on existing and required documentation
  • Identify missing documentation
  • Assist in drafting new documents based on interviews
  • Format documentation in a consistent manner
  • Review existing documentation for accuracy
  • Archive old documentation
Professional Skills to be Acquired:
  • Real-world experience in chosen field of interest and related topics through multiple hands-on projects
  • Critical thinking and analytical skills
  • Participation in design, implementation, and test discussions
  • Technical writing
  • Interview skills
  • Document formatting (Microsoft Office)
  • Broadening of knowledge base through regular technical and business topic showcases provided by Iridium
Specific Skills/Qualifications Desired:
  • Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and professional demeanor
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office product suite
Experience & Education Requirements / EEO:
  • Must be a minimum of 18 years of age
  • Must be currently enrolled in a bachelors or graduate degree program at an accredited academic institution (Communications or Computer Science preferred)
  • Must be eligible to work in the U.S.

Aurora is a leader in the development and manufacturing of advanced unmanned systems and aerospace vehicles.

Aurora Flight Sciences, a Boeing Subsidiary, is seeking qualified Interns to actively participate in real-world assignments, help solve challenging problems and contribute to the development of the next-generation of autonomous aircraft.

We Are Seeking Individuals With:

  • Structures Engineering or related experience.
  • A strong academic record.
  • Experience contributing to a team in a fast-paced, competitive and self-directed environment.

The duration of an internship typically lasts 8 - 12 weeks in any one of our sites:

Manassas, VA Headquarters, Engineering and Product Development
Cambridge, MA Research and Development
Bridgeport, WV Manufacturing
Columbus, MS Manufacturing and Final Assembly


Aurora offers a competitive compensation, housing and transportation allowance if required. Our mentors and team members guide you through your work, help you integrate in our culture of collaboration and further develop and gain new skills. Finally, during your time with us, we are interested in your input on how we can continue to enhance your experience in an environment of learning and at the end of your internship, we ask you to present your work experience and lessons learned to the company.

Aurora is a leader in the development and manufacturing of advanced unmanned systems and aerospace vehicles. During the last three decades, Aurora has designed, rapid prototyped, and flown an average of one new vehicle a year for government and commercial customers. Come change the future of the aerospace industry with Aurora Flight Sciences.

Are you looking for more?

At Mohawk Industries, we’re committed to more – more customer solutions, more process improvements, more sustainable manufacturing and more opportunities for our team.

Software Engineer Intern
Department: Engineering
Location: 320 Congress Street, Boston MA 02210
Join a company and be a key part of the Engineering team that provides the hardware, software, and certification platform that brings AI to aviation applications and enables unmanned air vehicles to be used for transportation and other missions.
Autonodyne is a well-funded young company focused on becoming the kernel for unmanned aerial flight. With a world-wide perpetual software license in place with Avidyne that covers $100M in aviation technology IP, expertise in aviation system certification, and a growing customer set, Autonodyne will develop, and if desired by the customer, certify systems and software for civil and defense aircraft that operate without a traditional pilot. While there are many companies providing products and services to the growing UAS market, we already have all of the necessary building blocks and move at higher clock speeds than the competition and are unique in that we are also experts in national and international certification which allows these products to be flown anywhere. Autonodyne is located in Boston, Massachusetts (and has a presence in Concord MA, Burlington MA, Dayton OH, Colorado Springs CO, and greater Los Angeles CA) and is looking for engineers who are interested in swarm/network topologies, artificial intelligence algorithms and the UAS/UAV/Unmanned space. This position reports to the Vice President, Engineering.
This is a paid internship position. Timing of the internship is flexible – it may run during the summer months or academic year, or both.
Position Summary:
As a software engineering intern, your principal work assignments will involve investigating various network topologies that will enable unmanned aerial vehicles. Often described as a swarm, Autonodyne is looking at optimum architectures for airborne vehicles. You will encode one or more algorithms for integration into simulation environments, and if the customer timing works out, potentially install that code onto actual flight platforms.
This work would be integrated with the Autonodyne mission computer software and control station software and the various augmented reality devices we are working with for control of the formation/swarm.
The Autonodyne products are currently a mix of existing product sets and many that are under development or haven’t started yet. We place a strong emphasis on graphical user interfaces (GUI) and natural user interfaces (NUI) along with high levels of autonomy and artificial intelligence.
We will be a focused team of engineers principally based in the Boston area working on a number of rapid-paced, high-energy programs. In short, you will be at the center of making the products a reality.

Responsibilities:

  • Become a subject matter expert in network and control topologies or work with engineers who are
  • Design control methodologies for large formations of autonomous, collaborative vehicles
  • Implement the designs in code (C/C++, iOS, Unity, etc)
  • Integrate these algorithms/code with the rest of the mission management system that is designed to be hosted on the vehicle mission computer hardware and control station system
  • Run simulations, as necessary, to validate and enhance system/software performance
  • Support flight test, as required
  • Explore and implement methodologies to accomplish what amounts to a ‘Self-Healing Network’ that is robust to losses of links, communications, etc.

Skills and Core Competencies:

  • Working understanding of existing relevant network topologies (e.g. Mesh networks, MIMO, etc)
  • Ability to code in C/C++ highly desired
  • Ability to code in iOS environment desired
  • Comfortable in simulation environments required
  • Familiarity with RF networks desired
  • Computer gaming interests/experience is desired
  • Ability to work in small, tight-knit and agile teams essential

Education/Certifications/Licenses:

  • BS (or higher) degree in Computer Science or equivalent complete or in-process desired

Experience:

  • Demonstrated knowledge in various network schemes and topologies
  • Experience (or a very strong interest) in UAS/UAV/Unmanned systems and/or robotics, especially in the avionics domain is highly desired

Travel:

  • No travel is expected but should be considered possible.

Other Criteria:

  • US Citizenship required

Job Description

ENSCO Inc., located in Springfield Virginia, is looking for a data scientist intern to join our engineering group in the ATE Division. The ideal intern will be motivated, self-starting, and have strong passion for pulling meaning out of data from a variety of sources. Data sources will include vision, machine learning, inertial, lidar, and other custom systems. This position offers the opportunity to enhance your educational experience by working with a team of engineers engaged in projects to design and deliver advanced data collection and inspection systems using a variety of technologies.
ENSCO’s Applied Technology and Engineering (ATE) Division designs, develops, and manufactures precision, high-speed, real-time vehicle, and track inspection systems for the national and international railway market.

Duties will include but are not limited to:
  • Participate in the development of data analysis scripts.
  • Work with Python, Excel, MATLAB, and other tools.
  • Benchmark machine learning algorithms and provide valuable feedback to improve designs.
  • Perform statistical analyses of time-based data sets.
  • Apply digital signal processing techniques in the frequency and time domains.
  • Work directly with software, image processing, signal processing, systems, and mechanical engineers to interpret data from a variety of sources and technologies.

Qualifications Required (Skills)

  • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent with a minimum of 1 year relevant (academic) experience
  • Working knowledge of statistical methods and signal processing
  • Exposure to tools such as SQL databases, C, C++, Python, MATLAB
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Good organizational skills

Division Description

ENSCO’s ATE Division is recognized globally as a leading provider of railway infrastructure inspection technology. Our products and services are provided to governments and railways in more than 12 countries on five continents. ENSCO work helps prevent train derailments and has a significant impact on the protection of human life, the environment and the economy.

Our team of more than 145 staff supports leading-edge technology projects in many exciting areas:
  • Sensor systems integration: inertial, positioning (GPS/RFID), laser scanners, imaging (line scan, area scan, thermal), ultrasonic, ground penetrating radar, LIDAR
  • Autonomous deployment of sensors, positioning systems and wireless communications on active rail cars to inspect railways
  • Machine vision algorithm development to detect conditions traditionally inspected by humans
  • Enterprise web-based data management systems to display, report and conduct big data analytics

ENSCO’s ATE Division is an exciting place to work and grow with many key benefits for technical staff, including:

  • “Innovation Fridays:” Staff is given time to create and experiment with new processes, best practices, and technologies in their field.
  • Involvement in all levels of the design and development process: Significant experience is gained that is not always available at larger companies that typically reserve serious engineering tasks for more seasoned staff.
  • Direct exposure to customer management, financial management and business development.

Working in ENSCO’s Rail Division provides a means to acquire a wide range of practical skills and experience in a short period of time, work on exciting and ground-breaking technology projects that impact transportation safety and offers domestic and international travel opportunities if desired.

ENSCO provides a stimulating, collaborative, multi-discipline environment with coworkers from diverse technical and cultural backgrounds working together to make the world a safer place. Come join a stable and growing company and experience the reward of seeing the results of your work make a real impact on solving some of the world’s most challenging problems.

Strength in Diversity

ENSCO, Inc. and its wholly owned U.S. subsidiaries are equal opportunity/affirmative action employers, committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic under state or local law.

Role Summary

As a Software Engineer Intern for FacilityConneX, you will be embedded in a close knit / cross-disciplinary team on commercially-facing development projects, typically involving streaming, complex data set.

You will work addressing statistical, machine learning, and data understanding problems in various commercial and industrial applications. In this role, you will contribute to the development and deployment of modern machine learning and statistical methods for finding structure in large data sets. You will leverage experience from various sources such as software developers, engineers, partner subject matter experts, and end users to define business problems, work with and manipulate data, develop analytical solutions, and execute analytical models and rules into production libraries aimed at specific commercial and industrial markets. Potential application areas include remote monitoring and diagnostics across facility infrastructure and industrial sectors, energy management, and operations optimization.

In this role, a heavy emphasis will be put on the build-out and conversation of our analytics library to our newest Python based framework.

Essential Responsibilities

In this role, you will:

  • Assist in the build-out of our analytics library on our next generation Python based framework.
  • Work alongside software developers, software engineers, and partner subject matter experts, to translate algorithms into commercially viable products and services.
  • Work in technical teams in development, deployment, and application of applied analytics, predictive analytics, and prescriptive analytics.

  • Working toward Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a “STEM” major (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics)
  • Strong interest in the fields of Computer Science, Data Analytics, and Energy Efficiency, and Equipment Optimization.

  • Familiar with the use of common data science related libraries, such as pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, SciPy, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, etc
  • Demonstrated skill working in some of the following programming languages, such as JavaScript, Typescript, HTML, CSS, Node JS, .Net, Go, Java
  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required

Desired Characteristics

  • Demonstrated awareness of critical thinking and problem-solving methods
  • Demonstrated awareness of latest web design technologies
  • Demonstrated awareness of presentation skills
  • Demonstrated awareness of how to leverage curiosity and creativity to drive business impact

About our group:

Seagate has one simple mission: to help the world save more of its precious data. Multiple studies have shown that machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data analytics are all improved with larger data sets. These methods are what is needed for the world to solve its important challenges from developing vaccines to combating climate change to improving autonomy in driving that saves lives. Unfortunately, however, the IDC projects that 158 of the 175 predicted zettabytes of data produced in 2025 will not be saved. By lowering the cost of storage, Seagate aims to rescue as much of this at-risk 158 zettabytes as possible to provide larger data sets and correspondingly improved learning, autonomy, and analytics. To achieve this goal, Seagate is harnessing the power of open source software to reduce data center costs. Our group is dedicated to this goal.

About the role - you will:

As a Developer Advocate intern, your role will be central to this important corporate strategy as you will help create the public face of Seagate’s open source initiatives. You will interact with a community who shares this vision to deliver the world’s best overall data center storage solutions optimized for both capacity and performance. In this role, you will evangelize Seagate’s vision and open source initiatives via blog posts, hackathons, meet-ups, and code integrations with popular third-party software suites such as pytorch, Map-Reduce, Kubernetes, and Spark for example. You will work to support and learn from our full-time developer advocates and gain valuable experience as well as an understanding of whether this unique type of role is suitable for a full-time career.

No community can be successful without an inclusive culture and you will be responsible for modeling and ensuring inclusive and respectful community behaviors to promote healthy growth and nurturing of the community. Additionally, you will represent the external community in internal forums to amplify their voices and smoothly deliver their contributions and ideas appropriately within Seagate.

Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.


About you:

  • PhD Degree (in progress) in Computer Science, Data Science or related fields
  • Currently enrolled student returning to school in fall 2021
  • Knowledge of third-party software suites such as Kubernetes, pytorch, Map-Reduce or Spark
  • Love to learn
  • Love to teach
  • Love technology
  • Love open source

Software Developer Internship

Role Overview

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Developer Intern to join our grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development lifecycles in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, or similar

· A foundational first principles understanding of software development concepts like algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Java/Groovy, Scala, or R

· A self-starter attitude to pro-actively tackle substantive and meaningful challenges

Desired Skills

The required skills are intentionally short and sweet, but there are a number of additional desirable attributes that we are also on the lookout for:

  • An understanding of power systems and power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • The development of REST-based microservices
  • Familiarity with agile-based software development

position: Computer Vision and Machine Learning Research Internship
description:
Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably. A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Siemens Healthineers develops innovations that support better patient outcomes with greater efficiencies, giving providers the confidence, they need to meet the clinical, operational and financial challenges of a changing healthcare landscape. Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as a Computer Vision and Machine Learning Research Intern.

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Computer Vision and Machine Learning intern, you will be responsible for:

  • Prototype design involving both hardware setup and software implementation
  • Machine learning algorithm design, implementation and evaluation
  • Advance the state-of-the-art, including generating patents and top publications

This position may suit you best if you are familiar with what is below, and would like to develop your career with Healthineers.

  • Current graduate students in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related disciplines
  • Experience with computer vision, robotics, and machine learning libraries such as OpenCV, ROS, Pytorch, Tensorflow
  • Hands-on software development on edge devices with C++ and Python, experience with CUDA and TensorRT is a plus

Required skills to have for the success of this role

  • Strong background in machine learning, optimization, computer vision, statistical filtering algorithms, planning/scheduling
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English is required
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a can-do attitude
  • Flexibility and adaptability to work in a growing, dynamic team
  • Must have a minimum GPA of 3.2 or higher
  • Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program
  • Must be available to work full-time during the summer (up to 40 hours/week) and feel comfortable working fully virtual
  • Permanent work authorization and F1 students will be considered

Overview:
Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) is a well-established and progressive defense contracting company in the Northern Virginia area just a few miles south of the Pentagon. We are a professional services firm established in 1972 that has a long-standing reputation for unrivaled technical and analytical support to some of the top decision makers in the Federal Sector. We do state of the art work and have a cadre of outstanding professionals on our team.

This internship is with the Surety Programs Group (SPG) which supports government and private sector organizations ensuring the security, safety, and reliability of high consequence operations. SPG’s philosophy is to help our clients understand and mitigate mission risks spanning physical, cyber, and human domains. The Data Science Intern will work as part of a cross-functional team responsible for systematically evaluating client threats, vulnerabilities, performance, and cost-risk trades.

SPA has near-term need for a Data Science Intern.
Responsibilities:
The Data Science Intern will participate in a range of analytical tasks including descriptive, explanatory, and forecasting projects. They will assist senior staff with data gathering, cleaning, storage, mining, analysis, statistical modeling, and visualization. In addition, the Intern will help senior staff develop new or improved analytical capabilities and tools.
Qualifications:
  • Pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, quantitative social sciences, or related discipline
  • Experience with data gathering, cleaning, storage, mining, analysis, statistical modeling, and visualization
  • Experience developing databases using either SQL Server or Access
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Experience with data analysis tools such as R, Tableau, Python, MATLAB, SAS, Stata, etc.
  • U.S. citizen with ability to obtain DoD security clearance
